page.title: 02VICTORIA SQUARE BOLTON
page.content: This large open space,in front of the Town Hall, has been pedestrianised and is even more important as a focus for the town's people.Every week day people sit on the benches and chat whilst others hurry to and fro between the shops and offices. The area is often used for advertising, displays and exhibitions. There are vans selling double glazing,giving public information or supporting charities. Displays by morris dancers, brass bands and youth organisations fill the square with music and laughter. At Christmas there is carol singing, on Remembrance Day a parade, and in late Summer a street fair. On special occasions the Mayor comes down the Town Hall steps, such as when Bolton welcomes officials from its twin towns of Le Mans in France and Paderborn in West Germany.
